def: That exaggerates; enlarging beyond bounds.-- Ex*ag"ger*a`ting*ly, adv.

To separate (the food) in its passage through the alimentarycanal into the nutritive and nonnutritive elements; to prepare, bythe action of the digestive juices, for conversion into blood; toconvert into chyme.
Inducing or stimulating the secretion of mucus; blennogenous.
A right of digging turf on another man's land; also, the groundwhere turf is dug.
A half bastion, or that part of a bastion consisting of oneface and one flank.
A white-flowered rosaceous shrub (Neillia, or Spir√¶a,opulifolia), common in the Northern United States. The bark separatesinto many thin layers, whence the name.
A genus of California pitcher plants consisting of a singlespecies. The long tubular leaves are hooded at the top, andfrequently contain many insects drowned in the secretion of theleaves.
A regiment, or two or more companies of a regiment, esp. whenassembled for drill or battle.
